subject: Psychology
title: The Components of Emotion
description: A 60-second lesson on The Components of Emotion.

hook.text: Your heart races, your face flushes, you clench your fists, and you think 'this is unfair.' That's anger.

buildup.text: Psychologists identify three components: physiological arousal, cognitive appraisal, and behavioral expression.

discovery.text: The body reacts (racing heart), the mind interprets (this is a threat), and behavior follows (fight or flee).

twist.text: Change any one component and the emotion changes. Reappraise the situation and anger can become amusement.

climax.text: Emotions aren't single events. They're systems ‚Äî body, mind, and action working together.

punchline.text: An emotion is a body, a thought, and an action at once.

quiz.question: What are the three components of emotion?
options: Physiological arousal, cognitive appraisal, and behavior
